character.appearance: Black fur with blond sandy spots and stripes, Ebony skin, Pink and gold eyes
character.bonds: Fletching is a time honored tradition passed down the family line. I won't break tradition.

text.p: Being accustomed to wandering through forest and woodlands, you have a keen sense of direction. When you are in a forest area you have an advantage on Survival Checks to either find your way through the forest, track a person or woodland creature, or find your way out of the forest. You also have an advantage on Nature Checks when determining the species of a tree or woodland plant.

At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with thieves' tools. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with thieves' tools) to gain this benefit.

p.b: Click the shield below to open you choices for rogue starting items.

text.p: Note: You only get these if your 1st level is in Rogue
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

list.li: You get either a rapier or a shortsword.
You get either 1) a shortbow, 20 arrows, and a quiver OR 2) a shortsword.
You get either a burgler's pack, dungeoneer's pack, or an explorer's pack.
You get leather armor, two daggers, and thieves tools.

text.p: During your rogue training you learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. Only another creature that knows thieves' cant understands such messages. It takes 4 times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

In addition, you understand a set of secret signs and symbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous or the territory of a thieves' guild, whether loot is nearby, or whether the people in an area are easy marks or will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

Beginning at 1st level, you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
The amount of extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.

You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions. Choose one type of favored terrain: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, or swamp. When you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to your favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled if you are using a skill that you're proficient in.
While traveling for an hour or more in your favored terrain, you gain the following benefits:

list.li: Difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel.
Your group can't become lost except by magical means.
Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.
If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.
While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

text.p: You choose additional favored terrain types at 6th and 10th level.

p.b: Click the shield below to open you choices for ranger starting items.

text.p: Note: You only get these if your 1st level is in Ranger.
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

list.li: You get either scale mail or leather armor.
You get either 1) two shortswords OR 2) two of any simple melee weapon
You get either a dungeoneer's pack or an explorer's pack
You get a longbow, 20 arrows, and a quiver.

text.p: Beginning at 1st level, you have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy.

Choose a type of favored enemy: aberrations, beasts, celestials, constructs, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, monstrosities, oozes, plants, or undead. Alternatively, you can select two races of humanoid (such as gnolls and orcs) as favored enemies.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.
When you gain this feature, you also learn one language of your choice that is spoken by your favored enemies, if they speak one at all.

You choose one additional favored enemy, as well as an associated language, at 6th and 14th level. As you gain levels, your choices should reflect the types of monsters you have encountered on your adventures.

Starting at 2nd level, your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

You hone your skills in the larcenous arts. Burglars, bandits, cut-purses, and other criminals typically follow this archetype, but so do rogues who prefer to think of themselves as professional treasure seekers, explorers, delvers, and investigators. In addition to improving your agility and stealth, you learn skills useful for delving into ancient ruins, reading unfamiliar languages, and using magic items you normally couldn't employ.
This archetype was inspired by a source under the Open Gaming License. The original content is copy left and can be found
All modifications are protected and all rights are reserved to the greatest extent permissible by law.

Starting at 3rd level, you can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open lock, or take the Use an Object action.
When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs you extra movement.
In addition when you make a running jump, the distance you cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Dexterity modifier.
By the time you reach the 2nd level, you have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does.

The Ranger table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell animal friendship and have a 1st-level and 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast animal friendship using either slot.

p.b: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher

text.p: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the ranger spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Ranger table shows when you learn more ranger spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the ranger spells you know and replace it with another spell from the ranger spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your ranger spells, since your magic draws on your attunement to nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a ranger spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

character.flaws: I speak with my axe, when the time calls for it, I don't yet understand men of other races aren't as interested in females that show off there strength.
character.ideals: A enemy unseen is a enemy that can kill you be the hunter not the hunted.

description.p: These rugged, thick, patched clothes are meant to protect your skin from the challenges of the woods. From snagging thorns to rips and tears these clothes were made to last... and if not that be patched.
The felling ax is great for cutting down trees. This tool does an extra 2d6 slashing damage when used on plants and other wood.
This solid iron wedge is great for jamming into a gap and forcing the two ends apart from each other.

id-00006.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00006.name: Splitter Wedge

description.p: This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again.
Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Placing a bag of holding inside an extra-dimensional space created by a handy haversack, portable hole, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one--way only and can't be reopened.

id-00008.name: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00008.nonidentified: This large burlap bag is approximately 2 feet in diameter at its mouth and 4 feet deep.

description.p: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch (described earlier in this section).

id-00011.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00011.name: Measuring Equipment

description.p: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

id-00015.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00015.name: Rope, Hempen (50 Feet)

id-00016.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00016.name: Piton

id-00017.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00017.name: Crocodile Hide

description.p: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

id-00018.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00018.name: Crowbar

description.p: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make this save."

id-00022.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00022.name: Backpack 2

description.p: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

id-00023.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00023.name: Candle

description.p: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch-or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel-takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

id-00030.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00030.name: Spear

description.p: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects, a block and tackle allows you to host up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

id-00033.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00033.name: Block And Tackle

description.p: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steal ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. the trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.
holds 18 pints

id-00036.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00036.name: Large Jug

id-00037.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00037.name: Shovel

id-00038.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00038.name: Bedroll

id-00039.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00039.name: Bottle of Celestial Hangover (Minus some sips)

description.p: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

This item encompasses a wide range of game pieces, including dice and decks of cards (for games such as Three-Dragon Ante). A few common examples appear on the Tools table, but other kinds of gaming sets exist. If you are proficient with a gaming set, you can add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set. Each type of gaming set requires a separate proficiency.

id-00041.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00041.name: Dice Set

id-00042.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00042.name: Hound of the Night Hide (Poor)

id-00043.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00043.name: Javelin

description.p: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

id-00044.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00044.name: Mess Kit

description.p: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

id-00045.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00045.name: Rations (1 Day)

description.p: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torchor anything else with abundant, exposed fueltakes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

id-00047.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00047.name: Tinderbox

description.p: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

id-00048.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00048.name: Torch

id-00049.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00049.name: Waterskin

description.p: When lit, this devices deals 22 (4d10) bludgeoning damage 3 rounds later to all creatures within 20 feet. Creatures that succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw take half damage.

id-00050.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00050.name: Explosive Device
id-00050.nonidentified: Some kind of device; there appears to be a fuse sticking out of it

description.p: You regain hit points when you drink this potion.
The number of hit points depends on the potion's rarity, as shown in the Potions of Healing table. Whatever its potency, the potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

id-00052.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00052.name: Greater Potion of Healing
id-00052.nonidentified: The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

id-00053.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00053.name: business documents

id-00054.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00054.name: Spear, Silvered

description.p: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes for 1 hour. The type of giant determines the score (see the table below). The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type. The potion of frost giant strength and the potion of stone giant strength have the same effect.

id-00056.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00056.name: Potion of Frost Giant Strength
id-00056.nonidentified: This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a giant of the appropriate type.

description.p: Great for carrying stuff around and the like.

id-00057.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00057.name: Large Burlap Bag
id-00057.nonidentified: This large burlap bag is approximately 2 feet in diameter at its mouth and 4 feet deep.

description.p: ERROR

Wars with fiends and demons forced the creation of new types of weapons. Men learned to forge in low temperature environments to change the nature of the iron so it could pierce the hot scales of demons. The process is not simple, and certainly not cheap, but to save your life it might be worth it.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

When you hit a dragon with this weapon, the dragon takes an extra 3d6 damage of the weapon's type. For the purpose of this weapon, "dragon" refers to any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles and wyverns.
When you roll a 20 on your attack roll with this magic weapon, your critical hit deals an extra 2d6 damage of the weapon's type.

id-00058.location: Black and Gold paterned Bag of Holding
id-00058.name: Vicious Cold Forged Iron Spear of Dragon Slaying

description.p: This glass jar, 3 inches in diameter, contains 1d4 + 1 doses of a thick mixture that smells faintly of aloe.
The jar and its contents weigh 1/2 pound.
As an action, one dose of the ointment can be swallowed or applied to the skin. The creature that receives it regains 2d8 + 2 hit points, ceases to be poisoned, and is cured of any disease.

character.name: Jenuel Flayer
character.notes:
A friend of Gront Fieron who went missing during his trail of age.

even though Helios down gnolls are generally half a foot bigger then gnolls from other worlds she is large for her race.

Her family is known for they're skill with bow.

She did scouting work for the city of Vab'alovobe reporting in threats and changes in the jungles and deserts around the city.

fought/killed: lots of Gnolls, 1 Gnoll Fange, 3 skeletons, 3 zombies, 1 wight, 1 Hound of the Night, 1 crocodile, bunch of lizard man, 

encountered: 1 weretiger, 4 Giant toads, 1 cockatrice, 1 monolith warior, 1 dryad

remembers creatures and they're smells
character.personalitytraits: I must always be on the look out for threats to me and my allies.

id-00002.name: Weapon: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, longswords, rapiers, shortswords

id-00005.name: Armor: Light armor, medium armor, shields

text.p: Although gnolls are cowardly at heart, they like to disguise their fears by abusing others. You have disadvantage on saving throws against being frightened. On the other hand, whenever you make a Charisma (Intimidation) check for dealing with obviously smaller or weaker targets, you are considered proficient in the Intimidation skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.
You have proficiency with the spear, shortbow, longbow, light crossbow, and heavy crossbow.

Although not, strictly speaking, different races, gnolls from the civilized lands live in an environment so different than their savage brethren that they are considered separate subraces. Choose one of them.
You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
When you take the Disengage action, your base walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

Whenever you make a Charisma (Persuasion) check for dealing with obviously bigger or more powerful targets, you are considered proficient in the Persuasion skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

id-00013.name: Vicious Cold Forged Iron Spear of Dragon Slaying

id-00014.name: Vicious Cold Forged Iron Spear of Dragon Slaying
